metadata.description: The name of the Synapse workspace.
The location of the Synapse workspace.
If true, grants SQL control to the workspace managed identity.

Provides the configuration for git-integrated workspaces. Ref: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/templates/microsoft.synapse/workspaces?pivots=deployment-language-bicep#workspacerepositoryconfiguration
The name of an existing service principal to set as the SQL Administrator for the workspace. This will be used as the login.
The principal/object ID of an existing service principal to set as the SQL Administrator for the workspace.
If true, enable diagnostics on the workspace (`logAnalyticsWorkspaceId` must also be set).
When `enableDiagnostics` is true, the workspace ID (resource ID of a Log Analytics workspace) for a Log Analytics workspace to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
The resource tags applied to resources.
When true, a single firewall rule is configured on the workspace allowing all IP addresses
When true, Azure Services will have access to the Synapse workspace even when 'allowAllConnections' is false
An array of objects defining firewall rules with the structure {name: "rule_name", startAddress: "a.b.c.d", endAddress: "w.x.y.z"}
If true, will ensure that all compute for this workspace is in a virtual network managed on behalf of the user.
SubscriptionId for existing virtual network to use when configuring private endpoints.
Resource group name for existing virtual network to use when configuring private endpoints.
Name of existing virtual network to use when configuring private endpoints.
Subnet to use when configuring private endpoints.
List of services to configure when enabling private endpoints. If not empty, virtual network related parameters must also be set.
The resource group name where private endpoints are provisioned. NOTE: Must be in the same subscription as the virtual network
When true, the private endpoint sub-resources will be registered with the relevant PrivateDns zone.
The name of the existing storage account that the default data lake file system will be created in.
The name of the filesystem to create in the storage account.
If true, grants "Storage Blob Data Contributor" RBAC role for the workspace managed identity on the storage account.
The subscription ID of the existing storage account. Defaults to current subscription, if not set.
The resource group name of the existing storage account. Defaults to current resource group, if not set.
The Azure AD group ID for the group to assign "Storage Blob Data Contributor" and "Reader" RBAC roles on the storage account resource group.
If true, the group defined by `datalakeContributorGroupId` will be assigned "Storage Blob Data Contributor" and "Reader" RBAC roles on the storage account resource group.
The parent storage account of the container
The name of the container
An array of objects defining firewall rules with the structure {name: "rule_name", startAddress="a.b.c.d", endAddress="w.x.y.z"}
The name of the storage account to apply the role assignement.
The name of the role to grant the assignee on the storage account. See: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/role-based-access-control/built-in-roles
The object ID of the assignee Azure AD group / service principal / user.
The assignee's type of Azure AD principal.
A GUID to use as the role assignment resource name, if omitted, one will be generated based on the storage account, role and assignee

roleDefinitionIds.value: [reduce(variables('roleDefinitionIdsArray'), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('next').key), lambdaVariables('next').value))))]

metadata.description: Dictionary of role name to role definition ID.
The resource ID of the role assignement.
The name of the storage account to apply the role assignement.
The name of the role to grant the assignee on the storage account. See: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/role-based-access-control/built-in-roles
The object ID of the assignee Azure AD group / service principal / user.
The assignee's type of Azure AD principal.
A GUID to use as the role assignment resource name, if omitted, one will be generated based on the storage account, role and assignee

roleDefinitionIds.value: [reduce(variables('roleDefinitionIdsArray'), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('next').key), lambdaVariables('next').value))))]

metadata.description: Dictionary of role name to role definition ID.
The resource ID of the role assignement.
The name of the storage account to apply the role assignement.
The name of the role to grant the assignee on the storage account. See: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/role-based-access-control/built-in-roles
The object ID of the assignee Azure AD group / service principal / user.
The assignee's type of Azure AD principal.
A GUID to use as the role assignment resource name, if omitted, one will be generated based on the storage account, role and assignee

roleDefinitionIds.value: [reduce(variables('roleDefinitionIdsArray'), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('next').key), lambdaVariables('next').value))))]

metadata.description: Dictionary of role name to role definition ID.
The resource ID of the role assignement.
The name of the private endpoint
The location of the private endpoint
The subscription of the virtual network the private endpoint will be connected to
The resource group of the virtual network the private endpoint will be connected to
The name of the virtual network the private endpoint will be connected to
The name of the subnet the private endpoint will be connected to
The resource Id of the service that will be accessible via this private endpoint
The service's sub-resource (if any) to be associated with the private endpoint
When true, the serviceGroupId will be appended to the private endpoint name with the convention: <name>-<serviceGroupId>. Useful when a resource exposes multiple services as private endpoints.
When true, the private endpoint sub-resource will be registered with the relevant PrivateDns zone
The subscription where the PrivateDns zones are managed, defaults to the virtual network resource group
The resource group where the PrivateDns zones are managed, defaults to the virtual network resource group
The PrivateDns zone the private endpoint will be registered in. When blank, the module will attempt to identify the required zone from a list of common services
The resource tags applied to resources
The resource ID of the private endpoint
The resource ID of the PrivateDns zone
An object representing the private endpoint resource

value.creator: Created by MDP provisioning to support private endpoint access to Azure Synapse SQL Pools

metadata.description: Name of existing private DNS zone that the CNAME record will be associated with.
The resource name for the CNAME record.
The value for the CNAME record.
Key-value pair metadata associated with the CNAME record.
The TTL (time-to-live) for the CNAME record, in seconds.

value.creator: Created by MDP provisioning to support private endpoint access to Azure Synapse SQL Serverless Pools

metadata.description: Name of existing private DNS zone that the CNAME record will be associated with.
The resource name for the CNAME record.
The value for the CNAME record.
Key-value pair metadata associated with the CNAME record.
The TTL (time-to-live) for the CNAME record, in seconds.
The principal ID of the workspace managed identity.
The resource ID of the workspace
The name of the workspace
An object representing the workspace resource
